intro: Androsace villosa var. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved rock sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to alpine and subalpine regions of Europe. It features dense, mat-forming growth with hairy, spoon-shaped leaves that are typically broad and fleshy. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers in clusters during the spring and early summer. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in mountainous habitats. Its botanical characteristics make it well adapted to harsh, high-altitude environments.
